thumb.title: I Thought I Could [original song, Vocaloid6, Taku & Jessica]
thumb.description: The song started life as sonic doodles using the Numanesque 1979 synth emulators -- so if you think it's 80s, you're a year out! Vocals from Vocaloid's Taku and Jessica ... with a smidgen of step-filter.Tech Notes‚ö† Warning: do not operate heavy machinery whilst readingThe retro simulator VSTs are from fullbucket.de -- they've been nicely stable within Cubase (I'm a bit precious about polluting the DAW with rogue plug-ins).A Paralogy emulator mimics a Crumar Trilogy in the intro; the sweep sound is the Ny simulator (Korg Lambda); A Korg DW-8000 emulator (FB-7999) fills in the chorus bass line. There's a Reason synth bass (Europa), and UAD bass (PolyMax) in there too. The bass components are largely side-chained from the drums to keep them under some semblance of control.The resonant sweep melody is from Reason's Thor; pads from PolyMax and Cubase's Padshop. And Retrologue.I had hoped to use the Drumtraqs emulator (also fullbucket.de) ... but they didn't settle ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è ... so swapped for Backbone soundset (and "impact" noises from there too).
